genresAdvancedInfo.name: nueva ola peruana
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Nueva Ola Peruana, also known as Peruvian new wave, emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of traditional Peruvian rhythms and melodies. The genre often features lyrics that address social and political issues, as well as personal experiences and emotions.
